xxl.core.pipes.memoryManager
Class UniformStrategy

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.memoryManager.AbstractStrategy
      xxl.core.pipes.memoryManager.UniformStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Strategy
public class UniformStrategy
extends AbstractStrategy

Implementation of a uniform memory distribution. This implementation always solves every memory overflow in a very simple way.

Since:
1.1

Constructor Detail

UniformStrategy

public UniformStrategy(int globalMemSize,
                       MemoryManageable[] memUsers)
Constructs a UniformStrategy with a specified amount of global main memory and registeres all of the memory using objects of the given array.

Parameters:
globalMemSize - The global amount of main memory (in bytes).
memUsers - the memory using objects to register.

Method Detail

handleOverflow

public void handleOverflow()
Handles a memory overflow. This method considers 80% of the difference of the total available main memory minus the memory used by monitorable objects as distributable and distributes it uniformly among all of the registered memory using objects.
If the monitorable objects use the complete memory, the manageable will get nothing.
If the monitorable objects exceed complete memory, an runtime exception is thrown.

Specified by:
handleOverflow in interface Strategy
Specified by:
handleOverflow in class AbstractStrategy
